Hail ECBers!

I have been wanting to do a version of Gizz's Charnel Lord that packs a bit more Bard goodness. Turns out there are three builds that already go for that, but are somehow different than this guy:

evo_dragon's Undeath's Eternal Champion which is a DEX-based toon,

Kail Pendragon's Mourning Glory which goes for more Bard levels and less fighter.

and Mith's Doom Skald, which is very similar, but goes for more pre-epic BAB and less AC.

This guy, however, has the same unbuffed AB as Mithdradates' build, EWS, which he doesn't get, but a much higher AC, thanks to EMA (attained at lvl 36). He has many gear slots free to cap Charisma, Constitution and Strength where I play, and having EMA, he can let go of the shield and use a Scythe to ALMOST have DevCrit. The only refined touch that Mith's build has that this one lacks is ESF:Taunt, but you can get that if you are willing to drop Epic Warding and delay Epic Mage Armor. Then, I would take the last PM level at 37th and only then go for EWS. To achieve that, I had to forego something, of course, and that something was HP (and Fort saves). But that weakness can be countered with gear.

IMO, with such a high AC, he won't really need HP that much, but there's always the casters. Nothing that a x4 Keen +5 Scythe critical hit can't handle. Anyway, here's my take on the Skeletal Musician:

His unbuffed AB is kind of lowish, but he can buff it very well:

40 +6 Capped Strength, +2 Bard Song, +5 GMW, +5 Curse Song +1 Bless Potion +1 Aid Potion +6 Taunt (although he can't Taunt high-concentration types) = 66 AB. Add a Divine Power Scroll and you can imagine

AC, however, is something else: 10 + 1 (DEX, a certain item I am planning to give him has +2 DEX as a property + Cat's Grace potion, scroll or wand), +20 (EMA), +4 Haste, +5 Monk Boots +1 Mage Armor + 10 Bone Skin, +2 Armor Skin +4 (Shield Bracers, which is a WoG item) +1 (+6 Full Plate available on WoG) + 8 (Full Plate) + 8 (Tumble) = 74 AC.

So, what do you think?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
One important reason to take 10 levels of pm or more is to get crit immunity for a dev crit environment. Another is to get epic spells (epic warding, epic mage armor) in a character that does not have lvl 9 spells.
For that reason I like to see dev crit in PM strength-builds.

As to your build, you can take 2 PM levels pre epic and delay bard (13) and (14) to epic levels. That will grant you more spots for skill dumps in epic levels or alternatively give you crit immunity earlier. The swap will also improve your saves from 18/20/20 to 21/19/22. The AB will not change.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:One important reason to take 10 levels of pm or more is to get crit immunity for a dev crit environment. Another is to get epic spells (epic warding, epic mage armor) in a character that does not have lvl 9 spells.
For that reason I like to see dev crit in PM strength-builds.

As to your build, you can take 2 PM levels pre epic and delay bard (13) and (14) to epic levels. That will grant you more spots for skill dumps in epic levels or alternatively give you crit immunity earlier. The swap will also improve your saves from 18/20/20 to 21/19/22. The AB will not change.
Well, with a x4 multiplier and 1.5 times his STR in bonus damage (with STR enhancements), GMW, Keen Edge and Flame Weapon from a wand, plus any bonus damage that the weapon itself has, his critical hits will be devastating, even without the Devcrit feats. Besides, most of the time, his AB won't be that great, because you need to be mindful of the Bard Song uses, and save them for the most important battles. Let's try to simulate what damage this guy would do on a critical hit:

[2-8 (weapon damage) + 6 (EWS) + 24 (capped STR x 1.5) + 5 (GMW) + 3 (Bard Song)] x4= 160 - 184 on a regular critical hit with a normal Scythe.

Other possible damage enhancements: Flame Weapon Wand (doesn't multiply on criticals), Bless Weapon Scroll (vs Undead only), Weapon Damage Bonus property (+1d6 typically where I play), +1d6 Holy Sword (vs Evil only), +1 (Prayer Scroll), +1 Divine Favor scroll (Magical Damage, and if your server, like mine, has caster level adjustment, if you buy your scrolls from a lvl 15+ Cleric, it can go up to +5), +2 Battletide scroll, +x Massive Criticals property (if applicable). There's still Deafening Clang for +3 Sonic damage (you can buy a wand with 50 charges where I play).

So, there's much room for improvement so that his criticals reach the 200 mark easily, maybe even 250 against certain types of enemies.

And I didn't even want to count another item, which is a server-specific thing, but on WoG there is a pendant which can grant you 3 daily uses of the Divine Might feat, and I had already planned to equip him with it if I ever got to play him there.

As for the other suggestion, it's a good one, definitely worth doing, but by doing that, you'll delay the acquisition of lvl 5 spells (Extended Improved Invisibility) a bit. Definitely worth it, though, will do that!

Thanks for the feedback, Mick!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I like this build alot, Max.

I see only one major issue:  Casting failure.  Obviously, you've taken some pains to assure this toon has decent casting prowess but without Still Spell, that constant swapping of plate on and off before an encounter gets old real fast and doesn't help with offensive casting anyway.  Granted, WoG may have armors with custom lowered spell failure properties but on most servers, full plate means about half of the casts will fail. And Stilled spells won't help you with Icestorms (or Dirge, if you decide to select that).

Problem is: some pre-epic feat must go in order to gain Still Spell since you are locked into at least PM 15 to access Epic Spells. That rules out Ftr 10 and Bard 16 is just too sweet to part with IMO.  That leaves either PA/Cleave (well, Cleave anyway) or Lingering Song for the swap if I had to guess.

Else, wear 10% SF leather armor (or lighter) and cap DEX items and buffs to +5 modifier. That will help offset the plate's base +8 some. Personally, I like arcane or monk robes but you know better than I the full repertoire of item properties to be found on WoG that might bypass the ever-looming spell failure issue.
